resources.string: You must select a user certificate
Unable to resolve the custom routing
Disconnect the connected VPN / cancel the connection attempt?
On some custom ICS system versions, /dev/tun may have errors or no such file at all. CM9 system users try the repair options in this program settings permissions repair.
DNS server: %1$s, 域名: %2$s DNS server: %1$s, domain name: %2$s
Obtained interface information %1$s and %2$s, the second address as a remote address. Use / 32 as the local mask. The pattern given by VPN is \"%3$s\".
Can not use %1$s and %2$s as routes in CIDR, subnet mask of / 32 will be used.
No IP information, refused to open the tun device
No CA certificate found in Android keystore. Probably verify failed.

Do not use the DNS server, unable to resolve the domain name, consider setting up a DNS server. Please note that even if you do not have a DNS server set up, the proxy server settings you set for mobile networks and Wi-Fi are also valid.
Unable to add DNS server "%1$s", %2$s has rejected your action.
Unable to configure IP address %1$s, rejected by system: %2$s
VPN unexpectedly crashed. We recommend that you send the dump file to the developer using the send dump file feature in the main menu
Wait for the server to respond

Some versions of Android 4.1 have problems if the name of the keystore certificate contains non-alphanumeric characters (such as white space, underline, or dash). Try reimporting a certificate that does not contain special characters
Pause connection when the screen is off: Less than %1$s in %2$s seconds
Warning: This VPN does not have the \"persistent tun device\" enabled. When the screen is off, the network traffic will not go through the VPN tunnel, but instead go Wi-Fi or mobile network.
Pause the VPN at the user\'s request
VPN suspended - the screen is off
Could not parse the certificate information
允许 VPN 应用程序： %1$s
You need to define and enable at least one remote server.
Restart the VPN service (application crashes - may crash or kill due to lack of memory)

Applications that are not allowed to be added. Add this application (%s) to make sure that there is at least one application in the list of allowed applications and all other applications are disabled
Preferred native ABI precedence of this device (%1$s) and ABI reported by native libraries (%2$s) mismatch
VPN permissions are removed by the operating system (such as other VPN programs started), VPN is stopped
Missing user certificate or user certificate key file
Reread (%d) log entries from the log cache file
VPN topology specified as "%3$s" but using ifconfig %1$s %2$s looks more like a netmask IP address. Assume the "subnet" topology.

Can not access Android key chain certificate. This may be due to a firmware upgrade or application / software setup by restoring the backup. Please edit the VPN configuration file and reselect the certificate in the basic settings to re-create the certificate access.
